title: PG&E's stock soars for a 2nd day; Kincade fire is now 30% contained
text: Shares of PG&E Corp. PCG, +22.07% soared for second day on Wednesday, in the wake of some reports of progress in containing the Kincade fire that has ravaged California's Sonoma County. The shares rose 19% in afternoon trading, to pace the NYSE's gainers. On Tuesday, the stock had blasted 32.4% higher, after plunging 53.7% in three days to close Monday at a record low given concerns the company may have helped start the Kincade fire. The California Department of Forestry and Fire Protection said as of Wednesday morning, 76,825 acres and 30% of the Kincade fire was contained. And the electric utility said overnight that it restored power to about three-quarters of the 973,000 customers affected by the Oct. 26 power shutoff, but also said it has begun turning off power to about 540,000 customers in response to a third-straight day of a "dry, offshore wind event." The company said it does not expect another wind event in the next seven days. The stock has still lost 67% over the past three months, while the S&P 500 SPX, +0.33% has gained 0.7%.
